description.$t:
Dale, Fredrick, Sherry, Stanley:

 These four pom-spaniels were dumped by their owners in Chino. They spent 3 days in the blistering heat over 100* when we finally were able to rescue them. They are sweet but very shy at this time. Fredrick has begun giving kisses and Stanly the oldest of these 4 is an attention hog. Sherry wants to be a lap dog. Dale is warming up with treats. These kids urgently need foster homes to learn that they will never be alone again. Please watch their rescue video here. (http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WXvkLAYJKLU)

Please contact SCPR- (socalpomrescue@coapc.com) for more information about this pet.

FANCY FLUFFY (6yrs) & YUMMY BURGER (2yrs) - 15lbs.
Fancy Fluffy and Yummy Burger (yup that's their real names) were dumped at the shelter in Los Angeles by their owner. They are a mother and son pair so it would be nice to keep them together. They get along fine with others. They are very friendly and social.

ARCHIE - 1.5yrs, 18lbs. Born 6/6/2012.

 
 Archie is a very sensitive dog. He is shy but not aggressive and wants to bond with somebody. This sweet boy likes to play and walks well on a leash. He would do well in a patient home where he can be adored as your only best friend. He is pee pad trained and will go outside if you let him.

Fruddy was surrendered to us from his owner who had to move and could not take him. At one time Fruddy had a fractured leg that was not fixed properly so he has a permanent limp. Fruddy takes a while to warm up to new people. He enjoys long walks and is a great little dog for a companion.
Raisin - young little guy who likes to go for walks and snugggle. Raisin is an active puppy who is very smart and loves people, cats and other dogs.

Amanda - 8 yrs. - 5 pounds

 This spunky, big eyed little senior girl came into our rescue very sick with a mammary tumor. She has a collapsed trachea and luxating patellas too. Her tumor has been removed and has had dental work done too! Amanda is feeling much better now and is ready for her forever home! Due to her small size and age, Amanda is not recommended for homes with young children.
Titan is a little shy and can be skiddish around women. He will need a gentle person to help him come out of his shell.

Corky Lee - 7-10 years, 15 pounds

 Corky Lee is a wonderful, loving dog who despite being partially blind is potty trained, walks on a leash, gets along with other dogs and cats. We are waiting for his blood panel results to make sure all is well (and rule out diabetes). Corky will also need a dental and small surgery to remove a cyst. Once his medical is finished he will be available for adoption. There is a possibility that sight can be regained through cataract surgery; however, due to his age it may be too late.

Jackson - 7 years old

 Jackson just arrived at our rescue so we don't know very much about him. We will update as soon as his foster gets to know a little more about him. We do know that Jackson is blind.

KATIE - 8yrs, 15 lbs.

 
The beautiful Katie just arrived at our rescue. We will update her bio as soon as her foster gets to know her a little better. We do know that Katie gets along with other dogs.

KYLE - 3-4yrs, 11lbs

 This sweet boy will be ready for adoption once he has a tumor removed on his belly.

WALTER - 6 yrs old, 22lbs (overweight)

 
 Walter he is just one big kid! Literally. He currently weighs 22 lbs. but should weigh about 12lbs. He is starting to smile a little more now that he is out of the shelter and feeling a bit better. He has a great attitude for what he is going through. He does have an eye irritation in his left eye that we will have looked at and his hind legs are very weak too. We'll look into that as well. We're still learning about him and we'll update as we can.

  

 *UPDATE' - Thanks to his foster, Walter is now down to his perfect weight of 12 lbs. He is so much happier and lighter on his feet. Check out his new video!

Arial is a 10 yr old female with a mass on her Paw and a heart murmur. She was left by her owner. Thank you to OC Animal Shelter for extending her time while rescue was found!! We will update as we learn more about her.

COOKIE - 5 yrs, 8lb 

 Cookie is a spunky black and white little girl who was surrendered to us by her owner for BITING. We have had her in rescue since July 2014 and while she is a darling little girl she will occasionally bite! She is currently being fostered by one of our experienced trainers who is working with her on the issue. We will update with her progress.

Noodles - 4 years, 8 lbs. 

  

 Noodles from sprung from Downey Shelter with a broken Paw and open wound on his flank. This little guy is now receiving the treatment he desperately needs and is healing nicely.

Max - 1 year, 5 lbs.

  

 *Max will be placed in a home with no other pets or children*

 During his initial exam, it was noted that Max may have vision problems and slight coordination problems. This may be due to his open fontanel. 

 What is an Open Fontanel?...

 When puppies (and human babies too) are born, the bony plates of the skull are separated and somewhat soft, allowing them to flex and pass through the birth canal. Generally after birth these plates gradually fuse and become rigid. The last place to fill in and solidify is the spot at the top of the skull where the four skull plates meet. If these plates do not fuse, we are left with a soft, unprotected spot at the top of the head that is called an open fontanel. In some very tiny breeds the fontanel may never close. A fontanel usually closes by 8 weeks but can sometimes close by 6 months.

 What if the Fontanel never Closes?

 A dog with an open fontanel may have a serious medical problem called hydrocephalus (water on the brain). Too much fluid on and in the brain creates pressure that effects development of the brain. Symptoms of hydrocephalus include seizures, blindness, lack of coordination, walking in circles, an large round dome on the head. There is no treatment for hydrocephalus.

 Living with a dog who has an open Fontanel 

  

 A puppy with an open fontanel can live out a normal life with certain precautions. They need to be in a home without other pets or small children. Care must be taken to avoid heavy grooming around the head, and any injury to the head. Keep in mind the puppy has no idea and will play rough and hard and perhaps fall from a stair or couch. If this happens unprotected spot could possibly cause serious brain injury.

CHEYENNE: 8yrs, 18lbs

This low key big boy is good with kids and gets along with other 
animals, including cats. He is not too interested in socializing with 
other dogs even when they want to meet him, but he is a gentlemen to all 
living beings. He loves to go on short walks and then chillax with his 
peeps. Doesn't needlessly bark -- just at the doorbell until the guest 
is inside. He is housetrained, and is currently getting over a nasty 
yeast infection on his skin.

QUIGLEY - senior, 8lbs

  

 Quigley is a senior Brindle Pom mix male. He appears to have unilateral Optic Nerve hypoplasia (failure of the optic nerve to develop fully), which may cause him to have impaired vision in his left eye which is significantly smaller. 

 Quigley also is noted as having seizures which may be connected to the Optic nerve. We will know more once he has been to our neurologist. Despite these findings, Quigley is an adorable lovely little guy who only weighs 8lbs. He likes to walk on a leash and is quite active for a senior. We just got him in and will update as we progress.

SHAUN: 2yrs, 14lbs

 This cute boy is a Lakeland Terrier mix who walks well on leash, is potty trained, and gets along fine with other dogs. He came in with Shannon (also listed). They can be placed together or separately.

Bear (5 yrs and 11lbs) is an SCPR alumni looking for a new forever home. His owners are no longer able to care for him and are hoping another wonderful home will be found for him. Bear is in wonderful health but has a history of snapping. He is now on medication that is helping him stay calm in stressful situations. He was originally found wandering the streets of Malibu. Bear will need an experienced dog adopter. He is doing extremely well with his foster and is a loving wonderful dog when not stressed. Bear would do best in a home with no other pets.

Chevy (3 yrs, 12lbs) ended up in rescue (along with his buddy Chewbacca) when his owners were unable to keep him due to local city laws and neighbors complaining. Chevy is super friendly and loves to cuddle. He gets along with cats, dogs and kids. This little boy is an escape artist so needs to be in control at all times.

Chipie is a 10 month male Terrier mix. He came to us so scared all he 
would do is hide. With the loving expert care of his foster, he is now walking 
on a leash, potty trained and learning to love and trust again. This boy will 
weigh around 13lbs when full grown.

Chris is a 6yr, 6lb male Pomeranian suffering from hairloss. We have had him on series of sulfur dips to help clear his skin condition. It is unknown weather his coat will grow back or not. He is a very sweet boy and gets along with everyone.

Meet Taz 5yrs and 7lbs.

 Taz was surrendered from his owner. He likes to go for walks and is pretty active. He gets along well with other dogs but rather likes to chase Cats.

 Taz has house manners but may need help with his potty training. His owner said that Taz tolerates children as long as they do not grab and pull at him. He is crate trained but will go potty if not let out when he needs to go. Since he is been in rescue we feel he is a smart dog and will settle easily once he is comfortable. Based on the owners comments, we will not place him in a home with toddlers.

Meet BuBu!

Breed: Formosan Mountain Dog/ Lab Mix
Gender: Male, Neutered
Age: 5.5- Month
Weight: 16 lbs
Dogs: Good with dogs
Cats: Good with cats
Kids: Good with kids
Housebroken: In Training 
Crate Trained: Yes
Leash: Good on leash
Energy Level: Medium

To see more pictures of BuBu, please visit http://pets.adoptgair.org/pets.php?pid=20050
To start the adoption process, please fill out the form at www.adoptgair.org/adoptionapplication

Courtesy Post! Please contact lisakuhnle@yahoo.com or call 909-206-7112 to inquire on Lexus! 

Hi, My name is Lexus! I am a super sweet lap dog! I am approximately 3 years old. I get along great with other dogs of all sizes and kids. I was found as a stray and turned into a high kill shelter. I was very pregnant and gave birth in the shelter. Thankfully I didn't have to stay in the shelter very long. I was rescued and am now living in a foster home. Two of my babies have already been adopted, and now it's my turn! 

I am about 15 lbs. I have beautiful eyes and a great personality. I would do great in a home where I can sit on someone's lap all day. I do get jealous over other animals coming near my person while on their lap, so I will need some work on correcting that behavior if there are other dogs in my new home. I am great at using pee pads while inside when my foster mom is gone, and going in and out while my foster mom is home. 

If you would like to meet me, please contact my foster mom! I am spayed, microchipped,  vaccinated twice, dewormed twice and treated for fleas and ticks. 

There is an application, contract, home check and adoption fee required.

Courtesy Listing! Please contact lisakuhnle@yahoo.com or call 909-206-7112 to inquire on Piper! 

Meet Piper! This petite girl was rescued from a high kill shelter. She was brought into the shelter with a broken leg. Our rescue went to the shelter to save a different dog, but when we saw her and learned about her story, we couldn't leave her behind. She had a significant fracture on her front left leg and a cast was put on. After a couple of months her leg was x rayed again and her cast came off! She has been doing very well since and her leg is completely healed. Piper is a Deer Chihuahua and they have long, fragile legs. She is about 7-8 lbs. We think she is about 3 years old. She is a very friendly, playful girl. She is great with other dogs and cats. She is good with kids, but a home with no small children would be best for her just because of how fragile this breed can be. She is a little lap dog and is so much fun to be around. She is doing well with using pee pads, but will still need some continued work with house training. She is a total doll and we really love her!! 

Piper has been spayed, microchipped, completely vaccinated, dewormed and treated for fleas and ticks. 

If you are interested in giving Piper a forever home, please email lisakuhnle@yahoo.com or call 909-206-7112.

*Courtesy Listing! Please contact lisakuhnle@yahoo.com or call 909-206-7112 for more information on Buzz*

Hi, My name is Buzz! My mom was rescued from the shelter, pregnant. I was born on Father's Day, along with my 3 siblings. My sisters have both been adopted, but my brother Woody and I are still looking for our forever families! 

I am an outgoing and playful boy! I love everyone I meet. I am just a puppy, and I am a good boy! I am great with kids and I am well socialized with other animals. I know to go potty on the pee pads while inside. My mom is about 15 lbs, and I am expected to be about 10 lbs full grown. I am currently only 3.5 lbs. 

I have been neutered, microchipped, dewormed and have had all three sets of my puppy vaccinations. I have also been treated for fleas and ticks. If you are interested in adopting me, please contact my foster mom! 

There is an adoption application, home check, contract and adoption fee required.
Click here to see my video.
Click here to see my video.

Sally is a 3yr smooth coat female that was released to us by her owner because she cant care for her anymore. When she was a pup a Husky attacked her and bit her on the skull which broke her jaw and left a scar on the top of her head. She spent 9 months at the vet hospital and then one the vet techs became her new owner until now. We believe she has trouble seeing out of her right eye but other then that she is totally healthy and loves attention. If you would let her she will sit in your lap and give you kisses. Sally is fine with other dogs but she has never been around small children so only older children please. Sally is spayed, vaccinated, and micro-chipped. She has completed her training at our trainers and whoever adopts her will get 2 free lessons with our trainer. So if you are interested in meeting Sally please fill out our adoption application at www.adoptasaint.org, or call Carole at 949 295 3641.

Maddie is a 1  yr old rough coat female that we rescued from a local shelter after her owners dumped her there. When we picked her up she was very skinny, missing patches of hair due to fleas and has kennel cough. She is on medication for the kennel cough, good food and lots of medicated baths to make her feel better. Maddie is a sweet pup that loves attention, belly rubs, good with other dogs big or small, and rides great in the car. She is vaccinated, spayed, and micro-chipped.  Now all Maddie needs is her forever home and lots of love. So if you are interested in meeting Maddie please fill out our adoption application at www.adoptasaint.org, or call Carole at 949 295 3641.

Duke is a 5 yr old rough coat male that we rescued along with his sister Daisy from their owner who could no longer take care of them. He is a big sweet boy that loves everybody, good with dogs big and small, and even good with cats. Duke is vaccinated, neutered, and micro-chipped. Even though he is big he is a mellow boy that likes car rides, walks, or just hanging out with his family. So if you are interested in meeting Duke please fill out our adoption application at www.adoptasaint.org, or call Carole at 949 295 3641.

Fife is a 7 yr old rough coat female that we rescued from her owner because she said she didnt have time for her anymore. When we took her in Fife only weighed 76lbs, was dirty, matted, and had a open wound behind her right ear. We had a complete blood panel done and it came back normal. So all Fife needs is a loving home that will give her lots of TLC. She is vaccinated, spayed, and micro-chipped. So if you are interested in meeting Fife please fill out our adoption application at www.adoptasaint.org, or call Carole at 949 295 3641.

Hogan is 2-3yr old rough coat male that we pulled from a local shelter after he was dumped out on the streets to fend for himself. When we picked him up he was very dirty, matted, and under weight by about 30lbs. Hogan is in a foster home with 3 other saints and per his foster dad he is a sweet happy boy but he deserves a family of his own. He is neutered, current on all her vaccinations, micro chipped, and rides great in the car.  So if you are interested in meeting Hogan please fill out our adoption application at www.adoptasaint.org, or call Carole at 949 295 3641.

My name is Bennett. I am a good boy, but it took me a while to be that way. I was treated very badly so I was scared most of the time. I think the home for me is with other dogs, one or two humans that I really like, and a quiet household. Teen and older kids would be better, no kids even better, you know how bothersome they can be, no I am just kidding. My best friend is Coco, a 75 pound pitbull, I like to hang out in her crate with her, and I like cats--go figure! If you think I can put up with you, please don't hesitate to contact www.thelittlereddog.com/form

Big Daddy is sweet and gentle with the puppies and his foster little brother as you can see. He is a very sweet boy, dog friendly but doesn't like the fluffy dogs or really nervous dogs, with a little more training and patience he will be the best dog--he walks well on the leash and is a really good boy. If you want to give Big Daddy a home, go to www.thelittlereddog.com/contact like all dogs and long walks and fetch, but he just wants to be loved. See his video here:http://youtu.be/3j7xBeDlQNo

See all of our adoptable dogs here:http://www.adoptapet.com/shelter82888-pets.htmlFind one you like? Fill out our application here:www.thelittlereddog.com/contactThe Little Red Dog Inc is a 501c3 non profit animal rescue. All of our dogs come spayed or neutered, full vaccinated and microchipped. We ask for a $275 donation at the time of adoption so we can save other dogs. If they are too young we will schedule it when they are old enough. All vet visits are included in the adoption donation. If you are interested in fostering, volunteering or adopting, please contact us!www.thelittlereddog.comLike us on Facebook!https://www.facebook.com/thelittlereddoginc

Bosco is a sweet pup who was kicked out of his home and left to fend for himself on the street. He is a sweet as can be and loves everyone, kids, people and dogs. He is a mellow boy and just wants to be loved. Consider this great dog. He will need exercise and lots of love. He just had a cherry eye removed and is doing great, he just needs a home!

Butch is a good boy. He is a sweet and friendly and three year old black and white male am staff mix who was found as a stray. Butch scored high on his temperament test at the shelter, which is unheard of and he is a very sweet and special boy. Walks well on the leash. He is in training and is a smart and sweet boy. He does get excited around some dogs. Overall he's a great dog for an active individual or family with older kids. He might be too excited around younger kids. He has nice medium energy and is a wiggly, happy boy who loves to give you kisses. Butch is a great pet for anyone living in a private home with a yard. He gets along with some dogs. We do not know about cats.
Please consider Butch, he would love a home of his own. if you are interested, please go to www.thelittlereddog.com/form

Captain is a sweet boy who is great with people. He is about a year old He has just completed obedience training. He looks like a chocolate lab but we think he has some am staff in him. He needs to be the only dog but he will love you like no other. A very sweet boy, he needs to continue with his training. Captain is a great dog

If you are interested in Darwin, please contact Rachel at: HollywoofToTheRescue@gmail.com or call 323-929-7311

My name is Darwin, aka Darwin Lovebug. I am an extremely GENTLE, massively sensitive, and personable 4 year old Staffordshire Terrier/Pit Bull mix. I weigh about 70lbs, but I'm essentially just an oversized lap dog (no, really- I am). I am always curious about what you are doing- so if you hear someone tip-toeing behind you, that would be me, Mr. Curious! I know basic commands, and I am housetrained- I do not like to be crated, but because I'm such a good boy, my foster mom trusts me alone while she's at work all day. Speaking of home life, I'm actually agreeable to smaller spaces, so apartment living is fine with me because I don't even like to go on walks. I'm just happiest and most content to be inside of a home all day, curled up with my favorite stuffed animal that I carry around for comfort and entertainment- I don't want much activity or have a desire to be outdoors as I am super sensitive to scary noises and activity (I think this is from being chained up in someone's backyard in my previous life before I was rescued).

I have been living with the same foster since June 2013, and little by little I have become less anxious around other dogs. I have been through socialization camp, which has boosted my confidence quite a bit, but I'm still scared of most other dogs when I am outdoors on leash (again, because I was always a backyard dog, I just never learned how to walk on leash calmly or how to meet other dogs). I guess you can say I am dog selective- a dominant, loud or pushy kind of dog will only upset me, but if you are a fun, calm dog, you and I can be best friends- just like my foster sister Mynka and I are (she's the white pit bull in the pictures- she is my favorite and yes, she's also looking for a forever home). I also have no toy or food aggression issues- I am not jealous and do not have any issues sharing, which is also great for any families out there with kids (which I do love as well, someone fun to follow around, take naps with, and watch tv next to at night).

All I want is a home to call my own, and a family who understands that I am just a sensitive but extremely loving dog whose confidence comes from the security and patience you give me.

I am neutered, microchipped and up to date on all of my shots. If you are interested in fostering or adopting me, let's set up a meet and greet! Please contact my foster mom Rachel at: HollywoofToTheRescue@gmail.com?

My name is Evie and I have been patiently waiting for a home of my own for 3 years!!
I was rescued from the Devore shelter when I was pregnant with 9 puppies. I was a good mom, and I am told I am a precious girl. I love to play ball and I will bring it back to you as many times as you can throw it. I love tug-a-war. One of my favorite treats is my peanut butter and yogurt Kong. I love to Chew on bones or bully sticks. I walk well on the leash and love to hike or even run. I play well with others but sometimes do get jealous when there are people around. I want your attention to myself and I would be ok being the only dog or if you have experience with large, strong breeds, you should be ok having me in the house with other dogs. 
I have two foster brothers, Caesar (an 80lb bull mastiff/lab mix), and Angel a 10lb pom. I LOVE people! I will show you how much I love you and express it with lots of licks/kisses. I am really smart and I will show you all my tricks: such as sit, down, shake, stay/come and I will even wait nicely at the door until you tell me OK! I love getting in the pool, and I am crate trained, well-mannered in the house, but I don't like cats. I would do best with an adult owner and older kids (teens). My foster mom says I am super sweet and super smart. If you will put some time and effort I learn quickly and I really want to please. Will you take a chance on me and give me a great home? I love my foster mom and home but really all I want is my OWN home for the rest of my life. If you take me home I will be a good girl and LOVE you until the day I die. I am a very loyal girl. If you want to meet me please go to www.thelittlereddog.com/form

I am in a foster home in Coarsegold, CA
The Little Red Dog Inc is a 501c3 non profit animal rescue. All of our dogs come spayed or neutered, full vaccinated and microchipped. We ask for a $275 donation at the time of adoption so we can save other dogs. . If you are interested in fostering, volunteering or adopting, please contact us!
See all of our adoptable dogs here:
http://www.adoptapet.com/shelter82888-pets.html

www.thelittlereddog.com
Like us on Facebook!
https://www.facebook.com/thelittlereddoginc

My name is Josie. I love everyone I meet and I am a good girl, sometimes I come on a little too strong, which puts some dogs and people off, but I haven't met anyone I don't like. I am sort of a bull in a china shop but love to go on walks, and good with other dogs and cats. I had really bad ear infections and I had to have surgery, so I really can't hear very well. I am learning some commands and I love to curl up with the family, I am a little drooly sometimes but a sweeter girl with a bigger heart you won't meet. Come meet me and see what you think! I bet you will want to take me home!

King and Tila are a pair of Bonded Pitbulls who have waited months in boarding for a home of their own. When their family had to give them up they were stressed, skinny and weary and really missed their family. They have gained weight back and are stunning looking dogs that catch the eye of people who comment on what good looking dogs they are.
They were raised in a family with 5 children, are extremely well socialized with people and love each others company.
They like to ride in the car, run on leash beside your bike and run hiking trails. They are well behaved and easy to control, walk very well on leash, sit when you snap your fingers and can plaster your face with big WET bully kisses.
King is not good with other dogs, probably would be with other females. 
Tila is good with most other dogs and has a little white poodle she liked. They were separated for several month and when we put them back together for the first time they were ecstatic. Their previous owners used to take them to soccer, football and basketball games and they were great with kids.
Since they are now 6yrs old we would like to keep them together and they are very good pets. Both of them are UKC purebred registered APBT's and Tila is a Purple Ribbon Champion line. I have all their paperwork going back seven generations. Please contact me if you would like to meet them and could provide them a safe, loving home. And if you have GRASS they might just love you as much as they do the Lawn!

Both dogs are FULLY Vetted and Ready for a loving Family to give them back their lives.

Mickey is an adorable, dog friendly boy. He is as sweet as they come, very gentle and patient. He was in a hoarder's house and not very well taken care of, but that doesn't stop Mickey from being a super sweet heart. Mickey had mange and healed nicely and now he just needs a home of his own. He looks to be a St Bernard mix, possibly with Am Staff, he is super cute and even sweeter, come meet him

If you would like to take a dog home forever, please fill out our form here:
www.thelittlereddog.com/form
he Little Red Dog Inc is a 501c3 non profit animal rescue. All of our dogs come spayed or neutered, full vaccinated and microchipped. We ask for a $275 donation at the time of adoption so we can save other dogs. If you are interested in fostering, volunteering or adopting, please contact us!
See all of our adoptable dogs here:
http://www.adoptapet.com/shelter82888-pets.html

www.thelittlereddog.com
Like us on Facebook!
https://www.facebook.com/thelittlereddoginc

If you are interested in Mynka, Please email Rachel at Hollywooftotherescue@gmail.com, or call her at #323-929-7311

 

"My name is Mynka, and I am a very joyful 3 year old female Pit Bull Terrier that weighs 55lbs. I am a class clown, and my goofy ears and spotted belly are always the first things people fall in love with. I am great on leash, well mannered in the home, completely housetrained, and I love kids. I have received two months of training & rehabilitation at The Fouche Way this summer, and I am now socialized and confident with other dogs; I prefer dogs who love to play but who are mellow & not dominant. I am currently living with another foster dog, a 65lb male pit bull named Darwin- we have no issues with each other and give each other confidence! I hope you will just come meet me and see how much of a low-maintenance and wonderful family dog I am!

I am also available to be fostered for a while to see if I'm a good fit for your home. Please email Rachel at Hollywooftotherescue@gmail.com, or call her at #323-929-7311 if you'd like to come say hello to me!"

Penny is about 2 years old and around 10 lbs. She is super loving and a total cuddle bug. She gets along with dogs, cats and kids. Not destructive at all and not much of a barker except for when she's playing with another dog or when she's excited because her human just got home.

If you are interested in Raider, please contact Gina Nichols at gina@ginanichols.com, or 949-351-7711


 


Raider is about 5 years ol, He is very people friendly tail always wagging. Beautiful boy. He is a little too strong for other dogs, but does not appear to be mean towards them just intimidating as he is so strong. Strong prey drive and we are working on that. Very love able though. :) If you are interested in Raider, please contact Gina Nichols at gina@ginanichols.com, or 949-351-7711

Sparta is 9 years old. He is amazing with children and gets along with smaller dogs better than larger dogs. He is fully potty trained, and crate trained, he does have allergies that are controlled with meds and food.. Please consider Sparta as a foster or forever dog, he lost his family a second time and is super depressed.

King and Tila are a pair of Bonded Pitbulls who have waited months in boarding for a home of their own. When their family had to give them up they were stressed, skinny and weary and really missed their family. They have gained weight back and are stunning looking dogs that catch the eye of people who comment on what good looking dogs they are.
They were raised in a family with 5 children, are extremely well socialized with people and love each others company.
They like to ride in the car, run on leash beside your bike and run hiking trails. They are well behaved and easy to control, walk very well on leash, sit when you snap your fingers and can plaster your face with big WET bully kisses.
King is not good with other dogs, probably would be with other females. 
Tila is good with most other dogs and has a little white poodle she liked. They were separated for several month and when we put them back together for the first time they were ecstatic. Their previous owners used to take them to soccer, football and basketball games and they were great with kids.
Since they are now 6yrs old we would like to keep them together and they are very good pets. Both of them are UKC purebred registered APBT's and Tila is a Purple Ribbon Champion line. I have all their paperwork going back seven generations. Please contact me if you would like to meet them and could provide them a safe, loving home. And if you have GRASS they might just love you as much as they do the Lawn!

Both dogs are FULLY Vetted and Ready for a loving Family to give them back their lives.

Tito and Thor were rescued from Mexico after they were dumped. They are very shy but do warm up. They are good with other little dogs and kids. They need some TLC to be great dogs! We would like to see them adopted together but will consider splitting them up for the right home

Newton is a good boy, goofy, sweet and smart. He is a bit aloof, but that may be because humans have let him down. He does get along with other dogs, but he will be best in a home with a neutral dog, or this big lug deserves a home of his own. He has been well trained, and is beautiful and ready for a home.

Female 
Chihuahua Mix
Brown
Spayed
Aprox 1 year old

Tasha is good with People and other Dogs, she was found wandering the streets, she is a good girl that needs a chance of a great home.

Loopie aka Luvey is the sweetest girl you will meet. She loves kids, cats, dogs, everyone. She had a lifetime of neglect. She is a distemper survivor, which speaks to her sheer love of life. She has a small tick from the distemper, which just adds to her charm. She was rescued in Mexico, she has powered through surgeries and illnesses and always remained sweet. She is a special case, she needs a loving person or family who will take care of her. When we rescued her, her teeth were rotting, we had to pull many of them, so her little tongue pops out now and then. She is now healthy, and ready to be adopted. Consider adopting Luvey aka Loopie or if you cannot, consider making a donation, we have spent thousands on her care to get her healthy, and we could use some support to take care of our other dogs in need. We think she is a corgi/doxie mix, in any case she is a 100% cute. She LOVES kids, and is very playful with small dogs. She is shy and nervous at first, but is really coming out of her shell. She needs a loving, patient home, will you give this special girl a chance?
Beela. She's a 4 yr old Dalmation/pit mix. Very mellow, and sweet, but nervous of new people and warms up quickly. She is really a good girl. Only about 35 lbs. Needs a quiet home, no kids

Mama Bear is a 3 yr old female pit bull, she's spectacular on s leash and great with other dogs. She could use some training, but otherwise a sweet girl who loves to burrow. If you are interested please contact Alanna Polcyn
PLPRescue.com
(530) 263-7248

Nico is a 16 yr mellow and easy going Cockapoo who would make a great family member and best friend! Nico loves all people including kids! He loves other dogs and seems fine with cats too! Nico has been fully vetted, is neutered and up to date on all of his shots. He is house trained and easy on the leash. He likes car rides, going for walks, and just being with you. He is a wonderful boy who still has a lot of love to give! Please call or email Wendy at 818-259-8271 or wendymbogdan@hotmail.com to meet Nico!

Wilbur is a chihuahua. He's a bit nervous but as soon as he gets used to you he loves to be carried and follows you around. He ignores cats and he's shy with new dogs. He's 10-15 lbs, and about 2 years old and we are working on potty training

Sonya and Joey, both adorable girls were rescued out of the deadly Devore shelter after being literally dragged and dumped there by their owner. They are bonded girls and we think that Sonya is Joey's mom. We would like to see them be adopted together. Sonya is full of personality and Joey is a bit shy. Both are super sweet! Sonya is a bull terrier mix and Joey is also a mix, but much smaller. Sonya is 3 and Joey is 1. We would like to find a home together. They do get along with dogs, but need slow introductions and both are cat friendly. they have been waiting several months to find a home of their own. They are good with kids, but they may do better in an older kid household

Scooby is 4 years old and very sweet. He is a doxi/chi mix. He was 45 minutes away from dying so we saved him from Moreno Valley. He needs a home. He will be neutered prior to adoption. He is really good with adults and likes to protect them. He would be good in an all adult household, or an older kid household. He is totally potty trained and very sweet!

unter is a handsome German Shepherd who is in need of a home! Hunter is about 8 yrs old and is very loving, gentle and sweet! Hunter is great with other dogs of all sizes, is neutered, up to date on all of his shots and in good health! Hunter likes car rides, is good on the leash, is well mannered and is great with kids and all people! He is a 60 lb gentle giant who was sad after his owners got divorced and left him at the E. Valley Shelter. He was rescued but still needs his forever home! Please call Wendy at 818-259-8271 or email wendymbogdan@hotmail.com for more info on Hunter!

Coco is a very special dog. Coco is a 3 yr cream pittie girl. 70 pounds. In a word she is SPECTACULAR! Coco sits and lays down on command even without a treat! She is at easy on the leash. She is INCREDIBLY GENTLE with children, cats and small dogs. This precious, sweet girl loves to love and be loved and petted! She was not greedy with treats and took them from kids and adults very gently. She is good with other dogs. She is medium energy - likes to play. good on leash...great with kids. Coco is pure love and jot. Coco is in a foster in Carpenteria

Check out her video below and attached:

http://youtu.be/38Yc_9csfJc

Shawnee is a shy and mellow girl, great on the leash--good with other dogs, in fact she really needs to be home with another dog--she loves them! She loves to nap and likes to be with her person. She definitely prefers women and is good with gentle kids.
